titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid to the Women Ambassadors Oral History Project oral histories SSC.MS.00204

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-10-25 09:27:42 -0400.

change.item: This resource was modified by the ArchivesSpace Preprocessor developed by the Harvard Library (https://github.com/harvard-library/archivesspace-preprocessor)
This record was migrated from InMagic DB Textworks to ArchivesSpace.

did.unittitle: Women Ambassadors Oral History Project oral histories
did.abstract: Collection consists mostly of oral histories conducted and collected by Morin of women ambassadors and state department employees, conducted in 1984, for her book, Her Excellency (1995). The collection also contains research files and typescripts of her book, Her Majesty, and a proposal and outline for a book, Madam Ambassador.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for use without restriction beyond the standard terms and conditions of Smith College Special Collections. Collection has not been fully processed and therefore may be difficult to use. Collection is stored offsite; researchers must give 48 hours advance notice. AV materials may not be viewed until in-house use copies are made.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ann Miller Morin donated this collection to the Sophia Smith Collection from 1998 to 2010.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Ann Miller Morin, born 24 July 1924, was the wife of a Foreign Service Officer. She gathered information, including oral histories, from 36 "female chiefs of mission, from the first one appointed in 1933 to the 44th appointed in 1983." The Women Ambassadors Project resulted in a book entitled Her Excellency, published in 1995.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: This online finding aid currently provides detailed description of only some of the additions to this collection. Materials from accession 01S-23 are described in unpublished lists that can be sent to you upon request by contacting specialcollections@smith.edu

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Women Ambassadors Oral History Project, Sophia Smith Collection, SSC-MS-00204, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Mass.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists mostly of oral histories conducted and collected by Morin of women ambassadors and state department employees, conducted in 1984, for her book, Her Excellency (1995). Included are interviews with Anne Armstrong, Jane Coon, Ruth Farkas, Millicent Fenwick, Jeane Kirkpatrick, Betty Dillon, Clare Booth Luce, Madeleine Albright, Jean Kennedy Smith, Mabel Smythe, Carol Laise, Margaret Tibbetts, Rozanne Ridgway, Anne Martindell, Constance Harvey, Nancy Ostrander, Mary Olmsted, Frances Willis, and Mari-Luci Jaramillo. The subject content of the interviews dates from circa 1933 to 1983. The collection also contains research files and typescripts of her book, Her Majesty, and a proposal and outline for a book, Madam Ambassador.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Ann Miller Morin retains copyright to her unpublished works within this collection. Copyright to materials authored by others may be owned by those individuals or their heirs or assigns. Permission must be obtained to publish reproductions or quotations beyond "fair use." It is the responsibility of the researcher to identify and satisfy the holders of all copyrights.
